bug.short_desc: Manual doesn't show visual highlights for search results

long_desc.thetext: If you search for a term in the manual, lets say "qooxdoo", the list of search results does show highlights (yellow backgrounds), but any page you open from that list of results no longer does, e.g. http://manual.qooxdoo.org/devel/pages/introduction/about.html?highlight=qooxdoo

This is done by a script (found doctools.js) that traverses a part of the DOM, highlighting search terms. The script expects the content to be found in "div.body".
Fixed highlighting on content pages by wrapping content in a div. With e804611 on master.

It would sure be nice to disable this. I use searching for some word to get me to the right page. Once I find a page I want to read, having that word highlighted all over the page makes it very difficult to read the page. I don't care about that search word once I find the page, so I'd like to be able to remove the distraction of the highlighting.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
